snippet: The lockout has been a boon for the Russia-based Kontinental Hockey League, as Alex Ovechkin, Evgeni Malkin and others have returned to their hometown clubs.
abstract: NHL lockout is a boon for the Russia-based Kontinental Hockey League, as Washington Capitals captain Alex Ovechkin, Pittsburgh Penguins center Evgeni Malkin and others have returned to their hometown clubs; KHL expanded rosters to allow for an influx of talent from overseas but limited its clubs to signing a maximum of three locked-out players.

byline.contributor: Jeff Z. Klein contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The lockout has been a boon for the Russia-based Kontinental Hockey League, as Alex Ovechkin, Evgeni Malkin and others have returned to their hometown clubs.

headline.seo: With N.H.L. Arenas Silent, K.H.L. Welcomes Stars and Buzz
headline.main: With N.H.L. Arenas Silent, an Overseas League Welcomes Stars and Buzz
headline.print_headline: With N.H.L. Arenas Silent, an Overseas League Welcomes Stars and Buzz
